thread.section_title: Angelina Jolie News plus Photos and Videos of the Actress | Daily Mail Online
thread.title: Angelina Jolie 'plotting a big acting comeback'
thread.title_full: Angelina Jolie 'plotting a big acting comeback' | Daily Mail Online

author: Heidi Parker For Dailymail.com
title: Angelina Jolie 'plotting a big acting comeback'
text:
Angelina Jolie wants back on the A list it seems.
On Wednesday The Hollywood Reporter claimed the 41-year-old actress is looking into several projects, including a sexy WWII spy movie and a Catherine The Great saga. The star last appeared on screen in 2015's By The Sea.
This comes as the Oscar winner's custody battle with Brad Pitt over their six children - Maddox, Pax, Zahara, Shiloh, Vivienne and Knox - seems to have taken a quieter turn.
Back: Angelina Jolie is planning a return to the A list it seems. On Wednesday The Hollywood Reporter claimed the 41-year-old actress is looking into several projects. Pictured Saturday
So royal: The 41-year-old star is also in negotiations for an adaptation of Simon Sebag Montefiore’s Catherine The Great And Potemkin: The Imperial Love Affair
Looks good: The humanitarian is in talks to star in The Spy Who Loved
According to the Reporter, the humanitarian is in talks to star in an adaptation of Simon Sebag Montefiore’s Catherine The Great And Potemkin: The Imperial Love Affair.
Catherine II of Russia was the most renowned and the longest-ruling female leader of Russia.
She reigned from 1762 until her death in 1796 at the age of 67.
The brunette bombshell is also considering The Spy Who Loved.
That's a World War II espionage drama based on Clare Mulley’s 2013 book.
And the Louis Vuitton model has already been confirmed to star in Maleficent 2.
This comes after a report that she was attached to Sony’s Shoot Like a Girl.
That one is based on the true story of Mary Jennings Hegar, an American Air Force major and helicopter pilot who served three tours in Afghanistan.
Brave: She is attached to Shoot Like a Girl based on the story of Mary Jennings Hegar
The script is being redone by Jason Hall (American Sniper).
Angelina is also developing Without Blood as a directing vehicle.
It's based on Alessandro Baricco’s 2004 novel, which chronicles the cruelties of an unnamed war.
And she has signed on to produce the children's film The One And Only Ivan for Disney.
The site also claimed she has turned down Wanted 2 and a Salt sequel.
And it was mentioned her being cast in Murder On The Orient Express and The Bride Of Frankenstein did not work out in the end.
Small: Jolie has stayed under the radar in recent years. Her film By The Sea - which she starred in, wrote and directed opposite Pitt - only made $500K
Wickedly wonderful: The last time she starred in a big, splashy Hollywood was film was in 2014's Maleficent
Jolie has stayed under the radar in recent years.
Her film By The Sea - which she starred in, wrote and directed opposite Pitt - only made $500K.
The last time she starred in a big, splashy Hollywood was film was in 2014's Maleficent.
And her next project is her directorial effort First They Killed My Father for Netflix which will come out later this year.
New project: Here she is seen on Saturday promoting her directorial effort First They Killed My Father for Netflix which will come out later this year. Maddox, Pax and Zahara are pictured
Pretty in pink: The Vogue cover girl greeted King Norodom Sihamoni of Cambodia as she arrives for the opening ceremony of the film First They Killed My Father in Siem Reap province
Last week she took her six children to Cambodia for the premiere.
The movie tells the story of Ung’s childhood as a Khmer Rouge survivor. Cambodia's King Norodom Sihamoni and Queen Mother Norodom Monineath Sihanouk were present.
Meanwhile, Pitt may be at the Oscars on Sunday as his film Moonlight is nominated for a Best Picture.
His Plan B Entertainment company will also crank out the Netflix military satire War Machine and director Bong Joon-ho's Okja.
Back in better times: Jolie and Pitt with their children in 2011
